name: Italian National Agency for New Technologies, Energy and Sustainable Economic Development
headAddress: Lungotevere Grande Ammiraglio Thaon de Revel, 76
goal:
ENEA Italian National Agency for New Technologies, Energy and Sustainable Economic Development. is the second major Italian research organization, with around 2500 staff employees distributed in its research centres and regional offices all over the national territory. The Agency’s activities are mainly focused on Energy Efficiency, Renewable Energy Sources, Nuclear Energy, Climate and Environment, Safety and Health, New Technologies, Electric System Research.
ENEA research activities are focused on the following sectors:
ENERGY EFFICIENCY : Support to Public Administration, Information and Training; Advanced Technologies for Energy and Industry
RENEWABLE ENERGY SOURCES: Concentrated Solar Thermal Energy; Photovoltaic; Biomass and Biofuels; Solar Thermal Energy at low and medium temperatures; Hydrogen, Fuel Cells and Energy Storage Systems
NUCLEAR ENERGY: Nuclear Fusion; Nuclear Fission
CLIMATE AND ENVIRONMENT: Environmental Characterization, Prevention and Recovery; Environmental Technologies; Energy and Environmental Modelling; Marine environment and Sustainable Development; Antarctic Expeditions and Research in Polar Areas
SAFETY AND HEALTH: Seismic Protection; Radiation Biology and Human Health; Radiation Protection; Metrology of Ionizing Radiation
NEW TECHNOLOGIES: Materials Technologies; Radiation Applications; Sustainable Development and Innovation of the Agro-Industrial System; ICT
ELECTRIC SYSTEM RESEARCH: Studies and research, under a Programme Agreement with the Italian Ministry of Economic Development, aimed at innovating the National Electric System to make it cheaper, safer and more environmentally-friendly.
Besides research, ENEA acts as national Agency in support of central and local Public Administration, enterprises and citizens. Specifically, ENEA provides services to Enterprises, Public Administration, Technologies and Expertise for Cultural Heritage Preservation, Radiation Protection Services, Radioactive Waste Management Services.
ENEA’s Brussels Office has the aim of promoting its international activities, strengthening its image and presence in Europe and its participation to international research networks and projects.
interests: Agriculture, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Culture, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, International co-operation and development, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Horizon 2020, Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions, ERC, KICs, ESFRI, ERA European Research Area, PPP – Public Private Partnerships (JTI), Public-Public Partnerships (P2Ps), Joint Programming Initiatives (JPIs), ETPs (European Technology Platforms), PRIMA Initiative, KIC (Knowledge Innovation Communities)
